sentences.en: Biometrics promises identities that are virtually impossible to steal, impersonate or misplace.
sentences.cn: 这种生物科技测量标准的特徵是近几乎不可能被偷取, 假扮,或误置.

sentences.en: Can you think of any reason why someone would want to impersonate him?
sentences.cn: 对于为什么有人想要扮成他,你能想出什么原因 吗 ?

sentences.en: Do not impersonate the user when using the queue.
sentences.cn: 不要在使用队列时模拟用户.

sentences.en: He can impersonate many well - known politicians.
sentences.cn: 他能饰演许多著名政治家的角色.

sentences.en: He gained entrance to the house by impersonate a local authority inspector.
sentences.cn: 他假冒地方当局检查员进入住宅.

sentences.en: He is an outstanding imitator and can impersonate all the well - known politicians.
sentences.cn: 他是个出色的模仿者,他能扮演所有著名的政治家.

sentences.en: He was caught trying to impersonate a military officer.
sentences.cn: 他企图冒充军官,但当场被抓获.

sentences.en: He was caught trying to impersonate a security guard.
I tried to impersonate a sleepy voice, and, again, failed miserably.
sentences.cn: 我试着假装刚睡醒时的声音, 而有一次悲惨地失败了.

sentences.en: In the film he amusingly impersonates a woman.
sentences.cn: 影片中他模仿一个女人，非常好笑。

sentences.en: It is illegal to impersonate a person of the clergy.
sentences.cn: 假扮或冒充神职人员是违法的.

sentences.en: Jo : It's a comedy programme where impersonate famous people.
sentences.cn: 学人家,模仿别人. 那参与这些节目的人都长得特像名人吗?

sentences.en: On the web, anyone can impersonate an expert. Anyone can blog.
sentences.cn: 而在网上, 任何人都可以把自己装扮成专家, 任何人都可以开博客.

sentences.en: They are left - wing activists, but they impersonate spokesmen of large companies.
sentences.cn: 他们是 左翼 积极分子, 但他们时常冒充大公司发言人发表言论.

sentences.en: Tom was a brilliant mimic who could impersonate most of the college staff.
sentences.cn: 汤姆的模仿能力是超一流的，他能惟妙惟肖地模仿学院里的大多数老师。

sentences.en: You should not attempt to impersonate Jagex staff in any way.
sentences.cn: 你不应该尝试以任何方式模仿Jagex职员.

words.tran_cn: 客观的；非个人的；没有人情味的；非人称的
非人称动词；不具人格的事物

trans.tran_cn: 模仿, 扮演, 人格化, 拟人
trans.tran_en: to copy someone’s voice and behaviour, especially in order to make people laugh
